person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The ratification of the treaty , which was signed in 1993 by the then right-centrist government , is being delayed by an ex-communist party , which won parliamentary elections in the same year and now dominates parliament .

Let's think step by step.

| Person |
| --- |
| the then right-centrist government |
| an ex-communist party |

In this paragraph, there are two "Person" entities:

1. "the then right-centrist government" - This is a government that is described as right-centrist and was in power when the treaty was signed in 1993.
2. "an ex-communist party" - This is a political party that was previously communist and won parliamentary elections in the same year the treaty was signed. This party now dominates parliament and is delaying the ratification of the treaty.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person |
| --- |
| the then right-centrist government |
| an ex-communist party |

In this paragraph, there are two "Person" entities:

1. "the then right-centrist government" - This is a government that is described as right-centrist and was in power when the treaty was signed in 1993.
2. "an ex-communist party" - This is a political party that was previously communist and won parliamentary elections in the same year the treaty was signed. This party now dominates parliament and is delaying the ratification of the treaty.

The other entity "parliamentary elections" does not refer to a person, but rather an event. Therefore, it is not included in the table.
